name: Bolt.new (StackBlitz)
tagline: AI web dev agent to prompt, run, edit, and deploy in the browser.
summary:
Bolt.new is StackBlitz’s AI‑powered web development agent that lets you prompt, run, edit, and deploy full‑stack applications directly from the browser. The open‑source codebase is published by StackBlitz, and the official tutorials walk through creating new projects, importing existing repositories, iterating with prompts, and deploying to production without local setup. Because it runs on StackBlitz’s WebContainers and cloud infrastructure, Bolt can start servers instantly, run package managers, and present a live preview as you and the agent iterate. 

Getting started is as simple as opening bolt.new, selecting a starter, or describing an app in natural language. You can refine the output with follow‑up prompts, open a file tree to make targeted edits, and ask the agent to handle routine tasks like wiring routing, auth, or styling. For teams, Bolt helps create prototypes, reproduce issues, or share minimal repros quickly. Migration typically involves importing an existing project via GitHub or ZIP, then using Bolt’s agent to refactor or add features before exporting or deploying. 

Bolt is best for browser‑first development where speed and shareability matter—hackathons, proofs of concept, tutorials, and demo‑driven workflows. Since the project is open source, developers can review the code and extend the agent for custom workflows; the official YouTube channel provides short, practical lessons on prompting tips and deployment patterns.
best_for: Web developers who want instant environments

limits.free_tier: Free usage tier available; see repo/docs

cons: Best for web stacks; not a desktop IDE

key_differentiators: WebContainers + agentic prompts in the browser
limitations: Frameworks outside web stacks may require workarounds
import_export: Import GitHub/ZIP; export project; deploy from browser
migration_paths: Import an existing repo into bolt.new; iterate and deploy
alternatives_notes: Alternatives: Replit Agent, Codespaces + Copilot, Stackblitz projects without agent
